intro: Willardia obovata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf willardia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps and marshes, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the summer months. Willardia obovata plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
